intro: Euphorbia terracina var. almeriensis, commonly known as the Almería spurge, is a succulent shrub native to southern Europe. It features thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are surrounded by colorful bracts. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. This variety is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
